content.user_title: Manage Linear issues and projects from command line
content.value_statement: Track and manage Linear issues without leaving your terminal. Create tasks, link issues, view details, and run GraphQL queries. Automate your project management workflow with a simple CLI interface.
actual_capabilities: List and search issues across teams with filters
Create, view, update, and delete issues
Link related issues and manage parent-child relationships
Add comments to issues from command line or file
Run raw GraphQL queries against Linear API
List teams, projects, and manage project membership
limitations: Requires separate installation of @0xbigboss/linear-cli Zig binary
File upload requires multi-step GraphQL process
Parent issue linking requires UUIDs, not issue identifiers
Interactive confirmation required for mutations without --yes flag

best_practices: Use --yes flag for all mutations to avoid interactive prompts in scripts
Get issue UUIDs with --json output when using --parent flag

anti_patterns: Using issue identifiers where UUIDs are required (--parent flag)
Running mutations without --yes in automated scripts
Hard-coding team IDs instead of using team keys

faq.question: How do I install the Linear CLI?
faq.answer: Run npm install -g @0xbigboss/linear-cli. Requires Zig 0.15.2 to build from source.

faq.question: What API key do I need?
faq.answer: Create a personal API key at linear.app/settings/api. Set it with linear auth set or LINEAR_API_KEY env var.

faq.question: Can I use this with any Linear workspace?
faq.answer: Yes. The CLI works with any Linear workspace where your API key has appropriate permissions.

faq.question: How does authentication work?
faq.answer: Auth uses Authorization header (no Bearer). Precedence: CLI flags, then LINEAR_API_KEY env, then config file.

faq.question: Why am I getting empty results?
faq.answer: Most likely missing --team flag. Check default config or specify --team TEAM_KEY explicitly.

faq.question: How is this different from the Linear API directly?
faq.answer: The CLI wraps the GraphQL API with convenient commands, filtering, and JSON formatting. Use linear gql for raw queries.
